page.title: 11The Gann Estuary
page.content: At the northern end of our sea estuary, the River Gann flows into Milford Haven, and adjacent to the estuary is Pickleridge lagoon These form salt marsh; mud flats; brackish water; reeded habitats which attract a great variety of birds. Migrants use the area for feeding and nesting throughout the year, wading birds such as the red shank, oyster catcher, cerlew, dunlin turnstones etc. are common and most other species of British wader can be seen. Gulls and cormorants are common with other sea birds such as terns and shearwaters seen when on passage. Duck use the Gann particularly in winter. Mallard, widgein, teal are often seen. In the reed beds, shelduck and swans nest, and buntings, marsh tits and king- fishers can sometimes be seen. Mudflat used by cockle gatherers and fishermen
